intro: Taenidia montana, commonly known as the mountain taenidia, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped flower clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers are often white or pale purple, and it produces small, dry fruits that contain the seeds. Due to its limited distribution, Taenidia montana is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
